description: Dive into "Capturing Funchal: Scenic Photo Adventures" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Funchal: Scenic Photo Adventures

places.generalDescription: Embark on a scenic 25-minute drive from western Funchal to Cabo Girao Skywalk, located on the stunning south coast of the island. This remarkable viewpoint offers unparalleled vistas of the Atlantic Ocean, Camara de Lobos, and Madeira's South Coast. At an impressive height of approximately 580 meters, it is one of Europe's highest sea cliffs. The site also attracts thrill-seekers as it is popular for paragliding and base jumping.

sources.snippet: Cabo Gir√£o Skywalk is a must-see destination for visitors to Madeira. Located just 20 minutes from Funchal, the skywalk sits at 580 meters above sea level and offers breathtaking views of the sea and cliffs below. Cabo Gir√£o Skywalk is a must-see destination for visitors to Madeira.
sources.shortName: Explore the Best Photography Spots on Madeira Island

places.name: Cabo Gir√£o miradouro

reviews.text:
Breathtaking views! This place is a dream! The glass floors add such an element of awe and amazement.

You are literally standing in the ocean!

It's very cool up here so bring your jacket!
Also, you need ‚Ç¨.50 to use the toilet.
There's a nice cafe here but not much else.

The Cabo Girao Miradouro is well worth the considerable uphill drive needed to get to it. It's only ‚Ç¨3 to get in (per person) but note that to use the restrooms is another 50c per person. There is a good cafe and gift shop on site too. There is limited parking however so whilst there are a few car parks they are small and this is a popular location so I advise visiting either early or late afternoon if you can. The views are simply remarkable. The height is immense and the views are something you cannot really capture on a photo, it's something you need to experience. Highly recommend checking this out when on the island.

Fun place. Medium crowded, but you could still get your photos without too much difficulty or wait. There's a nice cafe (coffee place) and big souvenir store. It's a reasonable price to go out on the glass floor overlook.

places.address: Estrada do Cabo Gir√£o, 9300-351 C√¢mara de Lobos, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Monte Palace Tropical Garden, located in Madeira, is a stunning garden surrounding the former pleasure estate and luxury hotel Quinta Monte Palace. The garden boasts a diverse collection of exotic plants from around the world as well as rare native species from Madeira. Created by local entrepreneur Joe Berardo in the late 1980s, this garden features an array of trees, flowers, fountains, ponds, waterfalls, statues, and Japanese-themed gardens with pagodas and carp ponds.

sources.snippet: A beautiful tropical garden located in the heart of Funchal, with an area of 70,000m¬≤,  the Monte Palace Tropical Garden is home to a huge collection of exotic plants and also to one of Portugal‚Äôs most important tile collections spread all over the garden describing moments of Portuguese historical significance.
sources.shortName: 20 Instagram Worthy Places in Madeira Island

sources.snippet: No Madeira picture article is complete without a shot of traditional Santana houses. They are kind of the mascot of the island. You can also see some example in the Monte Palace Tropical garden and the botanical garden.
sources.shortName: 40 best landscapes in Madeira (in photos)

places.name: Jardim Monte Palace Madeira

reviews.text: These are the most beautiful gardens we've been to. We arrived here via cable car from down in Funchal center and then we explored up here for the day. The gardens are kept immaculately and there are a lot of different gardens so you feel very secluded. This was definitely a highlight of our trip. There are lots of places to have snacks and sit down to admire the views and the terrain is quite hilly and cobbled.

Amazing botanical gardens that are truly stunning. The main themes seen to be Japanese and Africa, but their are plants from all continents. Its a vast and winding maze of interconnected pathways so takes a good few hours to fully explore, and easy to get lost. Also can be steep in places.

Best visited by the cable car from Funchal that stops right outside. There are cafes and a few random toilets dotted around, but take a packed lunch and just sit and enjoy the views whilst eating.

It can be noticably cooler in the gardens due to the altitude and cover, so dress accordingly and wear sturdy shoes. But definitely do go!

Beautiful place. Japanese style garden that's worth the visit......well maintained, some interesting exhibitions on top (art, minerals). When you spend your day exploring Funchal, we decided to do the garden in the morning, take the sleigh ride down the hill to Funchal city, walked around downtown and went back up the hill by cable car. A great day out and a nice change of scenery between hiking days.

places.address: Caminho das Babosas 4 A, Monte, 9050-288 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: PR11 Levada dos Balc√µes is a family-friendly hiking trail in Madeira Island that leads to a viewpoint offering stunning views of the Ribeira Frio valley and its lush forests. The approximately 1.5-kilometer-long trail takes you through the enchanting Laurissilva Forest, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

sources.snippet: To get to this viewpoint you can follow one of the easier levadas on the island: the PR11 Ribeiro Frio, to get to the plateau of dos Balc√µes in about an hour. These narrow irrigation channels crisscross the island's rugged terrain, lined by hiking trails, leading to the most beautiful spots on Madeira. This particular trail goes to Miradouro dos Balc√µes, a nice, yet small viewpoint, overlooking lush valleys.
sources.shortName: Madeira the Hawaii of Europe

places.name: PR11 Levada dos Balc√µes

reviews.text: Short but beautiful hike to a viewpoint. Gentle flat track along levada which is accessible to everyone. Can see the road from the track and current construction work on the road can make a section quite noisy but otherwise lovely. Lots of birds at the balcony.

A very short hike to a small view point that is marked by a large tree and lots of little birds that feed off people's hands.

The hike is in a lush forest on a trail that follows a levada. There's a little shack snack bar in the middle of the trail where you can have a nice view of the valley below but we didn't stop there. The end of the trail is a beautiful viewpoint overlooking a much larger panoramic mountain valley scenery. Lots of people love watching the finches feed in that spot. Not a huge spot so be careful not to go later in the day.
Easy hike.. Beautiful forest walk through the forest along a lavada to a beautiful overlook. Brind birdseed if you can get some as the birds at the top come straight to you!

places.generalDescription: Miradouro Eira do Serrado is a stunning viewpoint in Madeira, offering an incredibly high vantage point with minimal walking required. The breathtaking view of the mountains and villages below is truly unforgettable. It's advisable to bring a jacket due to the windy conditions at this elevated location. While the experience may be less impressive in low cloud cover, visiting during sunset can offer a more serene atmosphere with fewer crowds.

sources.snippet: The view from Eira do Serrado viewpoint overlooking the Valley of the Nuns and a remote village, Curral das Freiras is one of the most spectacular viewpoints in Madeira. The valley is actually a crater of a volcano with the village in the middle of it. You can drive a car to the very top of the hill, where the viewpoint is, plus there is a hotel, a cafe, and a souvenir shop.
sources.shortName: 15 most iconic Instagram spots in Madeira, Portugal

sources.snippet: The Miradouro Eira do Serrado (Eira do Serrado Viewpoint) is a must-see for any visitor to Madeira Island. The viewpoint is located on the north coast of the island, in the municipality of C√¢mara de Lobos. It offers stunning views of the Curral das Freiras, a small village nestled in a valley surrounded by mountains.
sources.shortName: 20 Instagram Worthy Places in Madeira Island

places.name: Miradouro da Eira do Serrado

reviews.text: Nice place to see great panoramic views, of course you are at the mercy of the weather‚Ä¶ we were here in the early morning, there were almost no people visiting so it was nice and pleasant.
Absolutely loved this place, spectacular views.We was lucky  with beautiful  weather. One downside, small  carpark,but free,better arrive  early if you drive.

Miradouro Faj√£ da Serra ‚Äì Stunning Views

A spectacular spot to stop and take in the beauty of Madeira. The view over the mountains is absolutely breathtaking, and you really get to appreciate the island's natural landscape.

If you love peaceful places with incredible scenery, this is definitely worth a visit.

places.address: Estr. da Eira do Serrado, Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: The Funchal Cable Car is a modern gondola that takes riders from Funchal to Monte, offering stunning views of the sea and mountains. The 20-minute ride provides a unique perspective of the city, with winding streets and clusters of houses resembling tiny models on a living map. At Monte, visitors can explore tropical gardens featuring exotic plants, flowers, and various animals.

sources.snippet: Visiting Monte has been probably the most popular Funchal attraction for many decades. At the beginning of the 20th century, tourists could reach the mountain by steam train. Nowadays, you can make the same journey and enjoy the scenery from Monte Cable Car (Telef√©rico do Funchal).
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things To Do in Funchal, Madeira (Ultimate Guide)
Madeira the Hawaii of Europe

places.name: Funchal Cable Car

reviews.text:
Now look; I'm not a lover of heights. In fact, I hate them.

However, I don't want the same fears instilling into my young 4 year old daughter, so I put my big boy pants on and went on the cable car ride to the top of the hills.

‚Ç¨20 return per person (or cheaper if you wish to toboggan ride it back down when you're at the top).

You know what, it was alright. I survived! Views are stunning, well worth a trip up!

üö° Another one for the tourist trail while in Funchal!
We arrived at the cable car station around noon and were surprised to see the queue wrapped around the building. üòÖ We decided to come back later, not realizing how much there is to do at the top of the hill!

‚è∞ Tip: Go early to make the most of your time there's plenty to explore once you get up there. You could easily spend a whole day enjoying the sights, grabbing a coffee at the caf√© ‚òï, and visiting nearby attractions üèûÔ∏è.

üõó The ride itself takes about 10 minutes. The cable cars were clean and spacious very comfortable!

‚úÖ Definitely recommend adding this to your itinerary while visiting the island! üå¥‚ú®

Riding the Funchal cable car was a great experience! There was no waiting time, and the ride itself was smooth and fast. The views over the city and coastline were absolutely stunning - a perfect way to take in the beauty of Madeira from above. Definitely worth it!

places.address: Av. do Mar e das Comunidades Madeirenses, 9060-190 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Pico do Arieiro is one of the highest peaks in Madeira, reaching 1,818 meters above sea level. Visitors can drive up to this peak and enjoy a cafe and gift shop with stunning views that often overlook the clouds. The area offers a magical experience, especially during sunrise or sunset when the sky is painted in beautiful colors.

sources.snippet: Pico do Arieiro is the third highest peak of Madeira at 1,818m (5,964ft) high, and from there, you get the most incredible panoramic views over the central mountains of the island.One of the island's most visually stunning hiking trails starts here and ends in Pico Ruivo, so if you‚Äôre not afraid of heights go for it. Sitting at an astonishing 1,862m (6,100ft) tall, Pico Ruivo is Madeira's highest peak. Ready to experience this with your own eyes?
sources.shortName: 20 Instagram Worthy Places in Madeira Island

sources.snippet: Writing an article about great photo spots on Madeira without including the mountains wouldn't be right, and with Pico Ruivo and Pico Arieiro, you have two very accessible peaks to explore. Both offer great views during both sunrise and sunset. The easier peak to get to is Pico Arieiro with its car park right next to the peak and Miradouro do Juncal just a five-minute walk from there.
sources.shortName: Five Great Photo Spots on Madeira

sources.snippet: One of the top Instagram spots in Madeira, the jaw-dropping views and steep cliffs of Pico do Arieiro, the third highest peak on the island, will fill you with an unforgettable sense of awe. This peak is famous for its beautiful 6-mile hike surrounded by mountain peaks and clouds. Keep in mind the terrain is difficult with a 3000-foot (1000m) incline on the return trip.
sources.shortName: The 23 Best Instagram Spots In Madeira (2025)

sources.snippet: If like me, you browsed images of Madeira on Instagram, one photo spot in Madeira I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve come across before visiting is Pico do Arieiro. I was truly amazed when I saw photos of Pico do Arieiro on Instagram as this Madeira viewpoint takes you right above the clouds!. How is it that Madeira has viewpoints so high they take you above the clouds!
sources.siteName: The Life of a Social Butterfly
sources.shortName: Best Madeira Photo Spots - Unmissable Instagram locations in Madeira

sources.snippet: The third-highest peak of the island, easily accessible by car. This was my second visit and each time we were rewarded with impressive views of jagged cliffs and endless horizons. Come early in the morning if you want to walk above the clouds, a majestic sight with the golden sunrise.
sources.shortName: Madeira the Hawaii of Europe

sources.snippet: One of my personal favorites is the mountain peak of Pico do Arieiro. With 1818m it‚Äôs the highest reachable location by car. If you want to climb further up, you have to take the exhausting hike to Pico Ruivo which I can recommend (5-6 hours in total).
sources.shortName: Madeira Island - Best Photo Spots for Landscape Photography

sources.snippet: Pico do Arieiro is the third highest peak on Madeira and the most easily accessible one. You can drive right up to it!. It was the first place I went to photograph after arriving in Madeira, and it remains one of my favorites.
sources.shortName: Photography Guide to Madeira: Best Locations, Tips, and More

sources.snippet: The most famous viewpoint in Madeira is without a doubt Pico do Arieiro. Therefore it‚Äôs also one of the most photographed photo spots in Madeira. The most famous viewpoint in Madeira is without a doubt Pico do Arieiro.
sources.shortName: Explore the Best Photography Spots on Madeira Island

sources.snippet: This spot is highly popular and one of the best photo spots on Madeira. No wonder ‚Äì you can see both amazing sunrises and sunsets here. Also you can easily drive to the Pico Arieiro top.
sources.shortName: Best Photo Spots on Madeira. What to See on Madeira?

places.name: Pico do Arieiro

reviews.text: Incredibly beautiful place for a sunrise and hike, but most of the hike is CLOSED indefinitely due to wildfires. The first 1.5km or so is open but after that it is closed with a ‚Ç¨2500 fine for anyone who tries to hike it despite the closure. There is a ‚Ç¨3 charge to hike the trail. Car parking is tough in the morning so be sure to get up early if you are aiming for sunrise. Nonetheless this is one of the most beautiful places I have ever been.

Great view to see the sunrise. We where in place about 5.30 in the morning still found parking spots near the entrance. Its better to go early. The views are breath taking. P.S. the parking is a bit expensive

Breathtaking place, I visited the sunrise, amazing views,
Be prepared for your hike
Arrive early
Proper footwear
Very narrow stretches
Inclines and declines are pretty extreme
Hydration and snacks very important.

places.generalDescription: The Madeira Botanical Garden is a hillside paradise boasting a bird park, natural history museum, and glass houses with stunning sea views. This modern marvel of contemporary architecture, co-designed by renowned architects Abalos & Herreros, features a unique latticed wooden canopy providing shade and dynamic interplay between light and shadow. The garden's design seamlessly blends with nature, offering visitors an immersive experience. Additionally, the Nini Design Center provides innovative spaces for exhibitions and workshops.

sources.snippet: Madeira is an island of flowers and Funchal is the city of gardens. Madeira Botanical Garden (Jardim Bot√¢nico). This is the biggest garden with the most varied collection of plants from all over the world.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things To Do in Funchal, Madeira (Ultimate Guide)
40 best landscapes in Madeira (in photos)

places.name: Madeira Botanical Garden

reviews.text:
Lovely gardens but not the best time in July to go. The spring is supposed to be spectacular with all the flowers in bloom. Saying that the gardens are pretty, lots of mature trees sans shrubs.

Lovely little cafe to stop for that break.

Nice place to spend an hour and a half or two. It's not as interesting as the Monte Palace Gardens unless you are very interested in different plant/tree types but still a nice place to wonder around and see the variety of flora and fauna. The cafe in the gardens did some good food as well.

The Madeira Botanical Garden is one of the true gems of the island ‚Äì a place where nature, peace, and breathtaking views come together in perfect harmony. Visiting it is not just a walk through a garden, but a full sensory experience that leaves you refreshed and inspired.

From the moment you enter, you are greeted with spectacular terraces filled with vibrant flowers, exotic plants, and lush greenery that reflect Madeira's rich biodiversity. The garden is beautifully organized, with each area showcasing unique species from around the world, as well as plants that are native to Madeira and rarely found elsewhere.

One of the highlights is the famous patterned flower beds, arranged like a giant carpet of colors ‚Äì a masterpiece of natural design and a perfect spot for photos. Another unmissable feature is the panoramic view over Funchal and the Atlantic Ocean, which is simply breathtaking and makes the entire visit unforgettable.

Beyond the stunning beauty, the garden also has a strong educational aspect. The labels and explanations are clear and informative, offering insights into the extraordinary flora housed here. You feel both relaxed and enriched by learning about such diversity in one place.

The atmosphere is calm and welcoming, with benches and shaded spots where you can simply sit, take in the scenery, and enjoy a moment of peace. The staff maintain the grounds with great care, ensuring everything looks immaculate.

Whether you are a plant enthusiast, a photography lover, or simply someone who wants to connect with nature while appreciating one of Madeira's treasures, the Botanical Garden is an absolute must-visit.

üåø I left with my heart full of joy and my camera full of beautiful memories. This place truly shows why Madeira is called the ‚ÄúGarden of the Atlantic.‚Äù Highly recommended! üåø

places.generalDescription: The CR7 Museum, located in Madeira Island, is a dedicated space showcasing the remarkable career of renowned footballer Cristiano Ronaldo. Visitors can delve into his journey through an array of exhibits including photographs, videos, interactive displays, and an impressive collection of over a hundred individual and team trophies earned while playing for various teams.

sources.snippet: CR7 is a museum dedicated to Madeira‚Äôs most famous football player ‚Äì Cristiano Ronaldo. He‚Äôs a living legend here and even Madeira‚Äôs airport has recently been named after him. I wouldn‚Äôt say that this museum is a must-see in Funchal, but if you are a huge fan and have half an hour to spare, you may want to take a look inside.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things To Do in Funchal, Madeira (Ultimate Guide)

places.name: CR7 Museum

reviews.text:
The Cristiano Ronaldo Museum is a must-visit for football fans! Located in a beautiful setting, it showcases an impressive collection of CR7's trophies and memorabilia.

One of the highlights was a stunning chocolate statue of Ronaldo-unique and creatively crafted. The museum offers plenty of parking, making it convenient for visitors. Nearby, there are nice restaurants to enjoy a meal after exploring the exhibits.

Overall, it's a fantastic tribute to one of football's greatest players. Highly recommended for an inspiring and enjoyable experience!

Such a cool experience for any football fan ‚öΩüèÜ The museum is full of trophies, photos, posters, autographs and gifts - a real journey through Cristiano's career. Tickets are ‚Ç¨5. One tip: if you come alone or as a couple, be aware that card payments are only accepted from ‚Ç¨15, so you might need to team up with someone else or pay cash.

Everything can be photographed üì∏, and when we visited there were practically no queues. The vibe is very relaxed - it's basically one big room, perfect for a 30-minute visit. If you'd like a souvenir, there's also a small merch shop üõçÔ∏è  And don't miss the statue of Cristiano right outside the entrance üôåüáµüáπ

Visiting the CR7 Museum in Madeira was an exciting and inspiring experience for any football fan, especially for those who admire Cristiano Ronaldo. Located in the beautiful city of Funchal, the museum is a celebration of Ronaldo's incredible journey-from his humble beginnings on the island to becoming one of the greatest footballers of all time.

The exhibits are thoughtfully organized, showcasing an impressive collection of trophies, medals, jerseys, and personal memorabilia. What stood out most was the attention to detail and how each stage of Ronaldo's career is brought to life, from Sporting Lisbon to Manchester United, Real Madrid, Juventus, and the Portuguese national team.

The museum also features interactive elements, video highlights, and even a life-size statue of Ronaldo, perfect for photos. It's more than just a showcase of awards-it's a tribute to hard work, ambition, and passion.

Whether you're a die-hard fan or simply curious about the legacy of one of football's legends, the CR7 Museum is definitely worth a visit. It offers a deeper understanding of the man behind the name and leaves you feeling motivated and proud of Madeira's most famous son. A must-see destination on the island!

places.address: Pra√ßa CR7, Av. S√° Carneiro 27, S√£o Martinho, 9004-518 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Cristo Rei is a clifftop monument in Garajau, Madeira, offering stunning views of the Atlantic Ocean. The statue, created by Georges Serraz in 1927, resembles the famous Christ the Redeemer in Rio De Janeiro. Visitors can take a leisurely walk to Ponta do Garajau and enjoy panoramic vistas of Funchal and the coastline.

sources.snippet: You may have seen the Christ the Redeemer photo spot in Lisbon, but this one is older!. To get to the statue, you can either take a scenic walk (which takes around 1.5 hours) from Funchal or do a tour like we did to see a variety of Madeira viewpoints. There are a number of scenic spots to capture your Madeira photos at the Cristo Rei viewpoint, including the beautiful stairway into the ocean‚Ä¶
sources.siteName: The Life of a Social Butterfly
sources.shortName: Best Madeira Photo Spots - Unmissable Instagram locations in Madeira

places.name: Cristo Rei

reviews.text: It was breathtaking! The statue offers incredible panoramic views of the ocean and coastline. It's an ideal spot for taking memorable photos and enjoying peaceful moments. Be sure to visit during sunset for a truly magical experience. It's definitely a must-see in Madeira!

The statue reminded me of a smaller version of Christ the Redeemer in Rio, though I'm not sure about the exact differences, just had that same vibe. It's a beautiful spot with a nice, peaceful atmosphere. The best part is that it's free to visit and open 24/7. There's a set of steps leading downhill to the base of the statue, and walking down felt really nice. You also get stunning panoramic views of the cliffs and the ocean as you go down, which makes the experience even better. The view looking up at the statue from below is also pretty impressive. They have cable cars that take you down to the beach for 5 euros per person, but we didn't try them. Overall, it was a really nice experience and definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

Beautiful statue overlooking the ocean.  Stairs take you down a path so you can see the statue on all sides.  Easy hike.  I think there are about 200 stairs.
Beautiful views of the ocean and coast line.
It's an iconic spot to see when visiting Madeira.
It is free to park and to enter the pathway.

places.address: Estr. do Cristo Rei, 9125-057 Cani√ßo, Portugal

places.generalDescription: The Jesuit College of Funchal, also known as Colegio dos Jesuitas do Funchal, holds significant historical value and is a must-visit when in Funchal. Situated on the Town Hall Square, this 16th-century architectural masterpiece was initially located in the guesthouse Sao Sebastiao before moving to its current location. The college's stunning interior features remarkable sculptures and paintings, making it one of Madeira's most notable buildings.

sources.snippet: Considered one of the most remarkable buildings of Madeira, the 16th-century Jesuit College of Funchal is also worth a short visit. Part of the buildings now house the University of Funchal. The college has a wonderful interior with amazing sculptures and paintings and can be visited from Monday to Saturday.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things To Do in Funchal, Madeira (Ultimate Guide)

places.name: Jesuit College of Funchal

reviews.text:
Guided historie tour of Funchal. 2 interesting hours touring Funchal, and filled with well-told histories.
Eventhough we have been here many times before, the knowledgeable guide, a student, brought forth so much from both the past and the present of Madeira and Funchal, that we did not know.
Thanks.
Fascinating church 1640s and if you are happy to climb stairs good views of Funchal from the roof. Worth a visit

This is a brief review of the tours undertaken by the volunteer students. Please take a tour with them. Very knowledgeable, and a delight to have a private tour guide of the city. I would recommend tipping at the end (as they are students). :)

places.address: R. dos Ferreiros Estrada, S√£o Martinho, 9000-082 Funchal, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Funchal Cathedral, a Gothic-style Catholic church dating back to the late 15th century, boasts an elaborate interior with three naves. The island of Madeira in the Atlantic Ocean is a stunning destination, abundant with vibrant flowers and aromatic fruits. Its volcanic landscape creates towering cliffs that offer breathtaking ocean views and conceal diverse wildlife and plant species. While Madeira is renowned for its tropical nature and botanical gardens, it also features well-developed cities with museums showcasing the island's rich history.

sources.snippet: Located in the city center, The Cathedral of Funchal (S√©) is one of the main historic landmarks of Funchal. Built in the beginning of the 16th century, at the peak of the Portuguese explorers‚Äô era, Funchal Cathedral is a symbol of power and prosperity. Not to be missed is the Gothic altarpiece, composed of gilt woodwork, oil paintings on wood, and small sculptures.
sources.shortName: 21 Amazing Things To Do in Funchal, Madeira (Ultimate Guide)

places.name: Funchal Cathedral

reviews.text: Located in the heart of the town, a lot of shops around the area, very serene area. When I visited the church it was quite crowded ‚Ä¶interior works are ancient gothic style. Pope John Paul II visited this cathedral in 1991. It's a national monument since 1910.

Very nice designs and artwork inside but the outside is quite plain.
The visit to the tower requires tickets which is a shame, making money in a place that tax plyers already pay for! I guess anything in Madeira is good for tourists to pay!
The church is always full of tourists. Buying the ticket in advance might be better. Exploring Funchal downtown by walking, you should stop here.

places.address: R. do Aljube, S√£o Martinho, 9000-067 Funchal, Portugal
